revised_title: Cell Division Cycle of Trypanosoma brucei brucei: Timing of Event Markers and Cytoskeletal Modulations
tldr: The authors analyze the cell division cycle of Trypanosoma brucei brucei, studying the timing and order of events within the cell cycle. They observe changes in cell form and internal features, focusing on the cytoskeleton's role in cell shape and division. The study provides insights into the infection biology of the organism and sets the foundation for future molecular approaches to understanding its regulation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
